Comments_List: Laboratory as a site and how it can be used as a site of analysis to reflect contemporary scientific discourse and practices.
A lot of voicing articulate opinions and thoughts in class discussion; a really interesting topic that I never thought to dive into before

Strengths: interesting readings, well rounded syllabus, engaged professor. Weaknesses: poorly engaged students. Even though we had to submit weekly reading questions, it was clear that not everyone did the readings, which really hampers discussion in a small class. Not the professors fault though, I would say. But discussion was lackluster and disappointing considering the interesting material. Exacerbated by the small class size.

Great readings, great topics, great field trips-- more background needed for this class though in terms of history of science, which I did not have, which makes the class more fun and exciting but it might help for class discussion
Yes, but shop it and make sure you like the other people and the professor.

Yes, I would recommend this course 100%! You learn so much about the history and development of laboratory spaces; if you're a science major or have any interest in learning about the subject with fascinating readings and interesting class discussions, this is the class for you.
Yes I would-- even for STEM students that want to know more about the origins of their workspace, the topics are really interesting and fascinating
